title: Whole Blood Processing (SepMate)

groups.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

request.title: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

source.description: Purify 20mL or 50mL whole blood using the following protocol:

cases.title: 50mL whole blood
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5f9aa","text":"To purify PBMCs from 50mL whole blood (per donor).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cslr","text":"For each donor, 50mL blood will be collected in 5 BD heparin tubes (green top).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: 20mL whole blood
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6r0p","text":"To purify PBMCs from 20mL whole blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2332v","text":"For each donor, 20mL blood will be collected in 2 BD heparin tubes (green top).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

source.description:
Centrifuge blood samples at
swinging-out rotor and brake off within
of collection.

Carefully transfer
from each tube in a 15mL tube avoiding the buffy coat, use remaining blood for PBMC isolation.

source.body: Note: To minimize PBMC loss during plasma separation, leave the clear layer level at least 1cm above the RBC.

source.description:
Centrifuge plasma at
in fixed-angle rotor (if a high-speed centrifuge for 15mL tubes is not available, aliquot plasma in multiple 1.5mL tubes and centrifuge at
). Transfer plasma to new tubes avoiding the pellet.

Aliquot
in multiple 1.5mL low bind tubes, freeze at
on the day of collection and move plasma samples to
after
.
Prepare SepMate tubes with Lymphoprep
Dilute whole blood 1:2 with DPBS (Ca/Mg free).

source.body: For 105mL total: and .

source.description:
Slowly pipette
down the side of the tube.

source.body:
Some mixing may occur between the medium and blood, but take care not to mix under the divider.
Unlike conventional gradient separation, do not tilt the tube when adding diluted blood.

source.description:
Spin at
with brakes ON.

source.body: Prepare three destination 50mL tubes (~30mL per Sepmate tube will be yielded.)

source.description: When the spin finishes, pour off the top layer from the SepMate tubes into your prepared destination tubes.

source.body: Do not invert the tubes for more than 2 seconds.

source.description:
Prepare 3 SepMate tubes per donor and add
below the insert by pipetting into the center hole.

source.body:
Take care to minimize any air bubbles below the plastic divider.
Video from SepMate manufacturers (~2min)

source.description:
Spin at
with brake ON.

source.body: First wash at higher RCF because gradient medium is mixed with the cells.

source.description: Pour off supernatant and combine pellets in three tubes to one, add EasySep buffer to 50mL.

Spin at
with brakes ON.

source.body: If yield is critical, ensure that the supernatant is clear; opaque supernatant indicates incomplete centrifugation of cells. If necessary, perform the spin at .

source.description:
Pour off supernatant, wash in
for a second wash.

Spin
with brakes on.

Pour off supernatant and resuspend in
.
Perform cell count.

Spin at
and resuspend in appropriate volume of freezing media A to get 10e7 cells/mL.

Prepare cryovials with
.

Add
from previous step to cryovials and gently mix by pipetting.

Place in freezing container for 1 day at
and move to LN2 tank for long term storage on the following day.

Centrifuge blood samples at
swinging-out rotor and brake off within
of collection.

Carefully transfer
from each tube in a 15mL tube avoiding the buffy coat, use remaining blood for PBMC isolation.

source.body: Note: To minimize PBMC loss during plasma separation, leave the clear layer level at least 1cm above the RBC.

in fixed-angle rotor (if a high-speed centrifuge for 15mL tubes is not available, aliquot plasma in multiple 1.5mL tubes and centrifuge at
). Transfer plasma to new tubes avoiding the pellet.

Aliquot
in multiple 1.5mL low bind tubes, freeze at
on the day of collection and move plasma samples to
after
.
Prepare SepMate tubes with Lymphoprep:

Prepare 2 SepMate tubes per donor and add
below the insert by pipetting into the center hole.

source.body:
Take care to minimize any air bubbles below the plastic divider.
Video from SepMate manufacturers (~2min)

source.description: Dilute whole blood 1:2 with DPBS (Ca/Mg free).

source.body: For 42mL total: and .

source.description:
Slowly pipette
down the side of the tube.

source.body:
Some mixing may occur between the medium and blood, but take care not to mix under the divider.
Unlike conventional gradient separation, do not tilt the tube when adding diluted blood.

source.description:
Spin at
with brakes ON.

source.body: Prepare one destination 50mL tube (~25mL per Sepmate tube will be yielded.)

source.description: When the spin finishes, pour off the top layer from the SepMate tubes into your prepared destination tubes.

source.body: Do not invert the tubes for more than 2 seconds.

source.description:
Spin at
with brake ON.

source.body: First wash at higher RCF because gradient medium is mixed with the cells.

source.description: Pour off supernatant, add EasySep buffer to 50mL.

source.body: Can scale washes to 30mL to save reagents.

source.description:
Spin at
with brakes ON.

source.body: If yield is critical, ensure that the supernatant is clear; opaque supernatant indicates incomplete centrifugation of cells. If necessary, perform the spin at .

from previous step to cryovials and gently mix by pipetting.

materials.name: Cryovial 2.0 ml round base internal thread screw cap writing area sterile
Mr. Frosty Freezing Container, 2mL tubes, Nalgene Mr. Frosty Freezing Container for 1-2mL cryogenic tubes, PC, clear w/ blue lid, 1/Cs.

description: Purpose: To purify PBMCs from 20 or 50mL whole blood (per donor). SepMate tubes will be used with Lymphoprep to ease processing time and effort.
